triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: The core subject matter - UAVs are the primary platform discussed throughout the review.

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: The paper reviews swarm formations and multi-robot coordination principles fundamental to UAV swarm systems.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Formation control and coordinated control of UAV swarms are essential control theory applications discussed in the review.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Path planning and trajectory planning are key methods for UAV swarm navigation covered in the paper.

triples.name: Robot navigation
triples.relevance: Robot localization and navigation are critical for UAVs to determine position and move autonomously as reviewed.

triples.name: Autonomous robot
triples.relevance: Autonomy in UAV swarms is a fundamental aspect enabling swarms to operate without constant human control.

triples.name: Wireless network
triples.relevance: Wireless communication is essential for UAV swarm coordination and information exchange between agents.

triples.name: Scheduling (computing)
triples.relevance: Task coordination and scheduling are methods used to allocate tasks among UAV swarm members.

triples.name: Control system
triples.relevance: Coordinated control systems are fundamental to managing multi-agent UAV swarm behavior and synchronization.

triples.name: Control system security
triples.relevance: The paper addresses security aspects critical for protecting autonomous UAV swarm systems from cyber threats.
